page.title: 04AINSDALE LIBRARY
page.content: AINSDALE LIBRARY WAS BUILT IN 1929. THE RAILINGS AROUND IT WERE SAWN OFF IN WORLD WAR 2 TO MAKE VITAL METAL OBJECTS LIKE TANKS AND GUNS. IT IS SITUATED ON LIVERPOOL AVENUE. THERE IS AN ART GALLERY WHERE PEOPLE CAN DISPLAY THEIR OWN WORK. IT HAS COLLECTIONS IN A GLASS CASE WHICH HAVE BEEN LOANED BY PUPILS FROM LOCAL SCHOOLS. IT HAS A CHILDRENS AND ADULTS SECTIONS WHICH CONTAIN FICTION, NON_FICTION AND SCIENCE_FICTION BOOKS. CHILDREN CAN TAKE 3 BOOKS OUT PER TICKET FOR UPTO 2 WEEKS. ADULTS CAN TAKE UPTO 6 BOOKS. EACH SECTION HAS A LIBRARIAN, BUT ONLY ONE IS FULLY QUALIFIED. PEOPLE CAN TAKE PART IN COMPETITIONS AND WIN PRIZES. THERE IS ALSO A SPECIAL COMPUTER WHICH RESERVES BOOKS.
